image.altText: A worker inspects steel products at the Whyalla steelworks.

props.synopsis: The former owner of the Whyalla steelworks, Sanjeev Gupta's OneSteel Manufacturing, owed $18.5 million in royalties when it was forced into administration last year, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: Former Whyalla steelworks' owner's royalties debt revealed

image.altText: Four members of Britpop era band Pulp sit in a studio among instruments and recording equipment

props.synopsis: Pulp had been among the acts prepared to boycott the festival over the cancellation of a slot with the Palestinian-Australian author at Adelaide Writers' Week.

title.children: Pulp agree to Adelaide Festival show after apology to Randa Abdel-Fattah

image.altText: A clocktower rises from a historic-looking building in a city.

props.synopsis: Adelaide City Council will consider supporting an alternative literary festival following the cancellation of the 2026 Adelaide Writers' Week.

title.children: 'Guerilla' Adelaide writers' festival could get council support

image.altText: A woman standing beneath a jetty.

props.synopsis: South Australian ecologist Dr Faith Coleman has resigned from two state government algal bloom panels and criticised the state government's approach.

title.children: SA ecologist resigns from algal bloom panels, citing government's 'adversarial' approach

image.altText: Laura Stein has short dark hair and is smiling

props.synopsis: Supreme Court Justice Laura Stein has been announced as South Australia's new Chief Justice — the first woman to be appointed to the role.

title.children: SA announces first female Chief Justice Laura Stein

image.altText: A woman wearing a necklace and smile to camera

props.synopsis: The Adelaide Festival Corporation, which oversees Adelaide Writers' Week, has apologised to Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah and says she will be invited to speak at its next event in 2027.

title.children: Adelaide Festival Corporation apologises to author Randa Abdel-Fattah

image.altText: Pelicans perch on a wooden structure near a body of water

props.synopsis: Environmental protections along a huge stretch of the River Murray will be boosted, following a decision to officially list the area as "critically endangered", the federal government says.

title.children: Major new developments will need to be assessed on River Murray

image.altText: A woman wearing an Akubra hat crouches down and holds a sheep's head in her hands

props.synopsis: More than 250,000 people do not have ready access to a vet in Australia, and according to the industry it is not completely down to a shortage. It is also a distribution issue which is also putting biosecurity at risk.

title.children: In vet care deserts, an hour can be the difference between life and death

image.altText: A large and unique looking purple and green flower

props.synopsis: A corpse flower at the Adelaide Botanic Garden is generating excitement but it is actually among five of the rare plant to bloom in the city this summer.

title.children: 'Smellanie' the corpse flower set to attract thousands to Adelaide Botanic Garden

image.altText: The smoke stacks of the Bayswater power station.

props.synopsis: In a move labelled a sign of the times, energy firm AGL was last week offering customers money to cut use during a heatwave.

title.children: Households 'paid to pare back' demand when power grid strains

image.altText: Josh Cavallo kicking the ball with his left foot in an A-League Men match.

props.synopsis: The head of Adelaide United says the former Reds player Josh Cavallo never raised concerns about homophobia or not being selected to play based on his sexuality while at the A-League club.

title.children: Adelaide United says Josh Cavallo never raised homophobia concerns with the club

image.altText: A woman wearing a seatbelt in the backseat of a car, her hands over a large black dog lying on her lap

props.synopsis: A South Australian man is due to stand trial after admitting to the manslaughter of his wife at a northern suburbs home, but has told a court he is not guilty of her murder.

title.children: SA man pleads guilty to manslaughter of wife, not guilty to murder

image.altText: A woman's hand holds a phone displaying a number of widgets for various apps.

props.synopsis: More than 4.7 million Australian social media accounts have been deactivated since laws banning children aged under 16 took effect in December, according to data released by the government.

title.children: Millions of accounts culled days after social media ban started, data shows

image.altText: A satellite image shows a large burnt area and smoke pouring from a fire.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of images captured by an orbiting weather satellite, and stitched together by the ABC, show the scale and destructive force of the Victorian bushfires.

title.children: 'Tentacles of fire' captured by satellites during bushfire crisis

image.altText: Families with candles at a vigil outside a prison

props.synopsis: Venezuela's new leader says political prisoners are being freed, but hundreds remain jailed, with families clinging to hope that America's intervention and ongoing pressure will eventually secure their loved ones' release

title.children: Zaida's son was snatched in the night, she's begging for his release

image.altText: A woman wearing a large winter coat protesting and holding her hands up at night.

props.synopsis: Such a move would allow the president to deploy troops to quell persistent protests in the city of Minneapolis, where two shootings connected to immigration crackdowns are fuelling public anger.

title.children: Trump threatens to invoke Insurrection Act over Minnesota anti-ICE protests

image.altText: Alexis Hutcheon sits on a stair well.

props.synopsis: A major Australian study finds standard antidepressants are not effective for around 20 per cent of people, who may need alternative treatments.

title.children: 'Night owls' less likely to find antidepressants effective: new study

image.altText: Group of workers in hi-vis, putting sand into bags, on grass ground, houses in background

props.synopsis: Rockhampton is bracing for possible flooding while communities in the already-sodden Gulf Country fear they may be isolated for "a long time to come" as ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji threatens more rain.

title.children: Rockhampton and Gulf Country communities brace for possible flooding

image.altText: A children's toy bear laying sideways on a floor.

props.synopsis: Documents detailing five years' worth of childcare breaches in the ACT reveal cases of educators slapping children, forcibly shaking them, throwing them, and possessing child exploitation material.

title.children: 'She was slapped': Inappropriate childcare educator discipline exposed

image.altText: A close up image of Kevin Rudd with his hand on his chin.

props.synopsis: Test your knowledge of this week's news cycle here.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: An early departure and an Aussie Golden Globe win

image.altText: Actors Connor Storrie and Hudson Williams pose for a photo on a red carpet with serious expressions

props.synopsis: Heated Rivalry has become a massive global hit, but can the steamy ice hockey romance, and other queer love stories, help create more inclusive spaces in the real sporting world?

title.children: Heated Rivalry and sports romance genre can teach lessons about queer inclusion

image.altText: A plume of black and grey smoke rises from a hill in the distance, with disposed fridges in the foreground.

props.synopsis: People are being urged to dispose of their batteries properly, after a series of fires at landfills across New South Wales.

title.children: Battery fire at tip could burn for weeks

image.altText: A dragonfly resting on a mobile phone with the Wikipedia page for dragonfly on the screen of phone

props.synopsis: Wikipedia is celebrating 25 years of the online encyclopedia and the enormous impact its had, while looking forward to its future. But some controversies from the past refuse to die.

title.children: Wikipedia is 25, but some old fights are still going

image.altText: Man in a grey hoodie standing on a beach.

props.synopsis: Up to 500 workers are fighting to recoup pay, super and entitlements after the collapse of a large disability support provider operating in New South Wales.

title.children: Workers lose pay, super as NDIS provider collapses

image.altText: An old newspaper clipping photo of two men and two women raising drinks.

props.synopsis: With whisky and lollies for sustenance and pigeons their only means of communication, Steve Harris and Doug Fleming crossed Bass Strait in a 4.5m dinghy in 1974.

title.children: How two 'foolhardy' blokes conquered Australia's most dangerous stretch of water

image.altText: A python resting on a straw mat

props.synopsis: It's fair to say when a Brisbane resident woke up to discover a carpet python curled up on top of her she was rattled.

title.children: 'Babe, don't move': Woman wakes up to 2.5-metre python curled up on top of her

image.altText: A memorial with piles of flowers stands in front of burnt out apartment buildings

props.synopsis: The final death toll is seven higher than previously reported and comes months after the fire tore through the apartment complex.

title.children: Hong Kong fire killed 168 people in total, authorities confirm

image.altText: Dozens of people on water ski boats at a river bank, with the Murray River in the background

props.synopsis: A report into the safety of ski racing on rivers is proposing to ban river racing events and limit speeds following multiple fatalities in recent years.

title.children: Safety investigation proposes banning waterski racing on rivers

image.altText: A close up of Jactina Allan speaking at a media event.

props.synopsis: Jacinta Allan vows to request a formal review of the state's disastrous bushfire season, following days of questions over issues like Country Fire Authority resourcing and the state's disaster preparedness.

title.children: Premier announces review into Victoria's disastrous bushfires

image.altText: Four astronauts, in white space suits and helmets, are strapped into their seats inside a space capsule.

props.synopsis: A capsule carrying four International Space Station crew members has splashed down in the Pacific, bringing their mission to an end more than a month early.

title.children: Astronauts return to Earth in NASA’s first medical evacuation

image.altText: An Australian and UK passport lay on a bench.

props.synopsis: Your guide to new UK and Ireland passport rules for dual citizens and general entry changes beginning in February.

title.children: How the new passport rules for UK dual citizens will work

image.altText: twisted green, blue tinged steel amid concrete pillars, and crumbling rubble and debris. a pickup truck is partially trapped

props.synopsis: A second fatal crane collapse in two days has been linked to the same construction company, a Thai minister says.

title.children: Second fatal crane collapse tied to same Thai firm, minister says

image.altText: A composite of screenshots of three Instagram reels about Grok from women

props.synopsis: The X AI is not creating sexually explicit images of women on its own, but the software "facilitates their abuse" acting on the requests of men "eager to violate women".

title.children: Behind Grok's mass digital undressing lies an 'unsurprising' truth

image.altText: Jannik Sinner applauds the crowd at a tennis match

props.synopsis: The Australian Open has smashed attendance records in what is being marketed as "Opening Week", featuring fan events and qualifying matches, but the main draw does not start until Sunday.

title.children: Complaints roll in as record crowds watch qualifiers in AO 'Opening Week'
